thread.title: Horror as dad and son 'not wearing seatbelts' killed in head-on crash with EACH OTHER
thread.title_full: Horror as dad and son 'not wearing seatbelts' killed in head-on crash with EACH OTHER - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Horror as dad and son 'not wearing seatbelts' killed in head-on crash with EACH OTHER
text:
Horror as dad and son 'not wearing seatbelts' killed in head-on crash with EACH OTHER Jeffrey Brasher, 50, and his son, Austin, 22, were driving in separate pickups when they were involved in the devastating crash Share Comments By Sophie Evans 23:00, 19 FEB 2017 News Jeffrey Brasher, 50, and his son, Austin, 22, were both killed in the head-on crash (Photo: Facebook) Share Comments Get daily A family has been left heartbroken after a father and son were killed in a head-on horror crash with each other.
Jeffrey Brasher, 50, and his son, Austin, 22, were reportedly not wearing seatbelts at the time of the tragedy in Alabama, US.
They were driving in separate pickups when they were involved in the collision in the early hours of yesterday morning, officials say.
Jeffrey, who had been driving a 2006 Ford pickup, was pronounced dead at the scene of the incident near Winfield in Fayette County.
His son was rushed to hospital , but despite medics' best efforts, he later died.
The pair, pictured when Austin was a child, were driving in separate pickups when they were involved in the collision (Photo: Facebook) Read More Biker's chin impaled on spiked railing after high speed crash in horrifying footage Jeffrey and Austin's grief-stricken relatives have since taken to social media to express their devastation at losing the pair.
One distraught family member, Jennifer Brasher, posted on Facebook that the dad and son "will forever" be her "guardian angels".
"I miss y'all so much already," she wrote.
She also posted a link to an article about the collision, which occurred at around at 4.10am yesterday, asking: "Can this all be just a dream?"
Pam Brasher Dennis also took to the social network to express her grief.
She posted: "Our hearts are broken while our faith remains in Him. There are no words to describe the heartbreaking loss of losing both Jeff Brasher and Austin Brasher.
Jeffrey was pronounced dead at the scene of the incident in Fayette County, while his son died later in hospital (Photo: Facebook) "There is peace in knowing they are together but our hearts are heavy knowing that they are know longer here with us.
"Please lift and cover our family in prayer during this extremely tragic time."
Pam had earlier asked her friends and relatives to "continue to pray" for Austin as medics at the hospital battled to save his life.
The young man, who died shortly before 9.30am, was driving a 2004 Chevrolet pickup at the time of the incident, according to the Trussville Tribune .
Read More A heartbreaking reunion: Young widow meets Army husband's coffin on airport tarmac after he died serving abroad The circumstances surrounding the crash remain unclear, but AL.com reports it is thought that neither of the victims was wearing a seatbelt.
A preliminary investigation has suggested that alcohol was a factor in the collision, according to Alabama state troopers and local media.
An investigation is ongoing.
Jeffrey and Austin both lived in Bankston.
Their funeral is set to take place on February 22 at Unity Baptist Church.
They will then be buried at Crossroads Baptist Church in Carrollton.
